justification: The article notes that, in the experimental studies it reviewed, "Participants make credibility judgments using a questionnaire (e.g., Ask & Landström, 2010; Hackett, Day & Mohr, 2008)." These questionnaires typically include items such as believability, credibility and truthfulness to operationalise complainant credibility.

When discussing ways to strengthen future research, the authors recommend convergent or discriminant validity checks "with other established measures (e.g., the Witness Credibility Scale; Brodsky, Griffin & Cramer, 2010)," indicating that witness (i.e., complainant) credibility can be measured with the Witness Credibility Scale.
